critique: This executive order from Barack Obama imposes sanctions on Iran due to its use of petroleum revenues for illicit purposes and attempts to evade international sanctions. It targets foreign financial institutions and individuals engaging in transactions with Iranian oil companies and for the purchase of petroleum or petrochemical products from Iran. The order aims to restrict Iran's access to the international financial system and limit its ability to fund activities deemed harmful. It includes exceptions for transactions involving food, medicine, or medical devices. The order reflects a focus on national security and foreign policy objectives, with an emphasis on executive power to implement sanctions.
